summary:
Document 1
Hello YouTube family, I'm sharing a dream I had last night that I believe is from the Lord. In the dream, I was driving and saw destruction and panic happening around me. I thought the rapture was happening, but I didn't hear the trumpets. I saw white spirit-like things floating in the air, which I later understood were souls going to hell. I called my friend Flora, and she told me they were souls that had died from rockets or missiles. I then saw a tsunami hitting, and I knew the rapture was very soon. After the rapture, destruction will come, and people will be left behind. I believe the Lord is showing us things that are soon to come so we can prepare and share the gospel.  I also want to share that my friend Christina had a similar dream of a tsunami hitting, and I'll let her share it with you guys. The Lord is trying to tell us that the rapture is soon, and we need to be prepared. We have the opportunity to help people not be left behind by sharing the gospel and saving souls. The tribulation will be worse than anything we've ever seen, and it's up to God to save those who have been planted with the seed of faith.  I urge you guys to rise up, step out in faith, and share the gospel. Planting seeds of faith is important, even if people don't come to faith right away. There will be many people who will come to faith after the rapture, and they will be saved. So, let's plant the seed and leave it in God's hands. I know destruction is coming, and I know the rapture is soon. I'll talk to you guys later, and I hope you have a great rest of the day.
Document 2
On October 1st, 2019, a Bible study was conducted on Matthew 24, focusing on the signs of the end times. Jesus answered the disciples' question about the end times by saying that many shall come in his name, deceiving many, and that wars, famines, and pestilence will occur. However, these are not the end times, but rather the tribulations of man. Jesus warned that the love of many will wax cold due to sin and greed.  The study highlighted the importance of being prepared and understanding the signs of the end times. Jesus said that the gospel will be preached in all the world, and then the end will come. The study also discussed the abomination of desolation, which will be a sign of the end times, and the importance of being aware of false prophets and false messiahs.  The speaker emphasized that the stars falling from heaven in Matthew 24 are not asteroids, but rather fallen angels, and that the end times will be marked by a reintroduction of these fallen angels. The study also touched on the idea of the great alien messiah and the deception that will come.  The final verses of the study emphasized the importance of being ready for the end times and understanding the signs that will precede it. Jesus warned that the day of his coming will be unexpected, and that only those who are faithful and wise will be prepared. The study concluded with a warning to be aware of the signs of the end times and to be prepared for the return of Jesus.
Document 3
Michael Matt, host of The Remnant, expressed his excitement and gratitude for the opportunity to share a positive moment from his stay in Rome. He revealed a new book by Bishop Schneider, which was launched at a special event attended by prominent Catholic figures, including Cardinal Mueller and Cardinal Burke. The book covers various topics, including the traditional mass, the Second Vatican Council, and the Pontificate of Pope Francis.  Matt emphasized that the event was a testament to the growing network of traditional Catholics who are working together to resist the errors of the Church. He cited Bishop Schneider's words, "Christ is winning already," and expressed his confidence that the good men in the Church will receive the necessary grace to fight against the forces of darkness.  Bishop Schneider's book, as described by Matt, is a powerful call to action for Catholics to reexamine their lives and stand up against the errors of the Church. The bishop draws on the example of Blessed Emperor Karl of Austria, who refused to compromise his faith even in the face of great pressure.  The book is a timely reminder of the importance of fidelity to the Catholic faith and the need for Catholics to stand up against the forces of darkness. Matt concluded by expressing his gratitude for the opportunity to share this moment with his audience and encouraging them to order the book and continue to fight for the truth.
Document 4
Communication with God is vital for believers, and it involves both speaking and listening. However, most people are better at talking to God than listening to Him. To listen to God, one must have the ability to hear Him, which is limited to believers only and is made possible through the indwelling presence of the Holy Spirit.   The approach to listening to God involves understanding how He speaks to people today, which is primarily through His Word, other people, and circumstances. To listen to God, one must be willing to spend time meditating on the Word, be attentive to what God may be saying through others, and be sensitive to His presence in their daily lives.  To develop a listening spirit, one must make listening to God a priority, pursue it with a teachable spirit, and persist in it. A listening spirit is characterized by five key traits: a teachable spirit, an attentive spirit, a humble spirit, a submissive spirit, and an expectant spirit.   A teachable spirit is open to learning and acknowledging the need to learn from God. An attentive spirit is willing to take the time to concentrate on listening to God and to meditate on His Word. A humble spirit acknowledges the need to learn and be taught by God. A submissive spirit is willing to obey what is heard from God. An expectant spirit is anticipating God speaking to their life and expecting to receive from Him.  By applying these simple truths and making listening to God a priority, believers can develop a listening spirit and learn to hear from God in their daily lives.
Document 5
Michael Pearl is answering a Bible question about a near-death experience where a man claimed to have seen lukewarm Christians going to hell for unrepented sins. Michael dismisses this idea, saying it's not based on Scripture. He argues that the Bible teaches that salvation is not dependent on repenting of all sins, but rather on trusting in Jesus Christ.  Michael references 1 Corinthians 5:5, where Paul instructs the church to deliver a sinning Christian to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus. He also cites John 5:24, which says that those who hear and believe in Jesus have everlasting life and will not come into condemnation.  Michael also references Romans 8:29-35, which describes God's design program for those who will become his children. He argues that those whom God foreknew will be saved, and that those who depart from the faith will not be.  In Hebrews 3:6, Michael finds a warning to Christians to hold fast the confidence and rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end, lest they depart from the living God. He argues that this means that salvation is conditioned upon staying in the faith and continuing to trust in Jesus Christ.  Michael concludes that many Christians are not truly born again, spirit-filled children of God, but rather fake Christians who will fall into various sins and deny the faith. He emphasizes the importance of holding fast to one's confidence in Jesus Christ in order to be a partaker of Christ and ultimately go to heaven.
Document 6
I'm Messianic Rabbi Zef Porat, and I'm here to share a special outreach update from Jerusalem, Israel. We're living in prophetic and exciting times, with the second coming of Jesus Yeshua drawing near. The veil is being lifted, and Jews and Arabs are being saved like never before. The gospel is going forth, and the enemy is losing its grip.  I recently shared the message of Yeshua in the Kotel area, asking people who they trust. A known rabbi, Harav Tzadok Manor, approached me, furious and angry, telling me to leave. But the Holy Spirit gave me a word, confirming that I should continue to preach. I asked the rabbi if he knew who God is, and he became defensive. However, with the help of another Jew, we opened the Bible and read Isaiah 53 together, revealing the truth about the Messiah, Yeshua.  The power of the Holy Spirit was present, and the rabbi became calm and speechless. We read more Bible passages together, including Psalms 119 and 27, and I gave him my contact information, encouraging him to call and not be afraid. Yeshua is calling him to salvation.  We will not be intimidated and will continue to preach the gospel, no matter what. Romans 1:16 says, "For I'm not ashamed of the gospel, for it is the power of God for salvation, to everyone who believes." We will continue to preach the word of God until all Israel shall be saved.
Document 7
Good morning, I'm Tina Spaulding, a trance channel for Jesus. Today, we're discussing Lesson 32 from the Course in Miracles: "I have invented the world I see." This lesson continues the theme of cause and effect, emphasizing that you are not a victim of the world you see because you created it. You can give it up as easily as you made it up.  The idea for today applies to both your inner and outer worlds, which are interconnected. To practice, repeat the idea for today while looking around your outer world and then your inner world. Treat them equally and repeat the idea as often as you wish.  Jesus joins us, saying that this concept is challenging but not to worry if you don't believe it now. You're in a training program, and these ideas are meant to be accepted through faith, not understanding. He reminds us that our worldview and self-concept are being challenged, and our ego may resist this new perspective.  Jesus encourages us to be gentle with our ego, which may feel vulnerable when we let go of defensiveness and attack. He reminds us that we are the creators of our reality and that defending ourselves only prepares us for attack. By aligning with truth and love, we can soothe our ego and become wiser.  Remember, you are blessed beings, and these lessons are meant to guide you on your journey. Thank you for joining us today.
Document 8
We're in ancient Susia, a Jewish settlement in the West Bank, dating back almost 2,000 years. The site features a synagogue with significant findings. In the synagogue, an Aramaic inscription translates to "remembered for good, Yeshua, the comforter, martyr witness." This is remarkable as it's from around 350 AD, just a few hundred years after Jesus' time, and refers to Jesus as the Comforter. Additionally, a scene on the opposite side of the synagogue resembles the book of Revelation, featuring two olive trees and two candlesticks.
Document 9
The speaker is criticizing Paula White, a spiritual advisor to Donald Trump, for saying that satanic pregnancies should miscarry. This statement is deemed insane and not based on any biblical concept. The speaker argues that charismatic Christianity often prioritizes experience over doctrine, leading to false teachings. They claim that Paula White is not led by the Holy Spirit and has a history of immorality. The speaker warns against following her teachings, books, or attending her church, as they believe she is a charlatan and a minister of Satan. They urge people to seek biblical truth and leave churches that promote false teachings. The speaker compares Paula White's statement to that of Charles Manson, implying that it's equally disturbing. They express concern for both Paula White's well-being and the well-being of her followers.
Document 10
The speaker reflects on the world's darkness and the longing for hope. They ask if creation is groaning for a new beginning and if the glory of the Lord can be a light in the midst of shadows. The focus shifts to Jesus, the Lion of Judah, who conquered death and is worthy of all blessing, honor, and glory. The speaker affirms Jesus' worthiness, emphasizing his role as the Lamb who died to ransom humanity and his connection to the Father and the Spirit. Ultimately, the speaker declares Jesus' worthiness and the promise of God's presence among us.
Document 11
The speaker believes that the seven-year peace deal mentioned in the Bible is imminent, and it will be ratified by world leaders, including Donald Trump's peace plan. They claim that all signs point to the rapture, with the birth pangs increasing rapidly. The speaker expects the rapture to happen soon, possibly within a month, after the Israel election in April. They mention God's signs in the heavens, including wars, natural disasters, and bizarre weather, indicating that the end times are near. The speaker expresses sadness that few people are ready for the rapture, as less than 1% of Christians share their faith, and many are backslidden or refuse to repent. They warn that those left behind will face seven years of hell on earth, where billions will die in horrific circumstances.
Document 12
Happy Rosh Hashanah. The speaker believes the current season may be the rapture season, but they don't think it will happen this year due to other events on God's plan. Israel is in uncertainty with no government formed after two elections. The speaker shares two prophetic words:   First, the name Benjamin is significant, as there are two Benjamins in the current Israeli election, both rivals. The speaker believes this is prophetic, referencing the biblical story of Joseph and his brother Benjamin. The number five is also significant, representing grace, and Benjamin Netanyahu has been elected four times, with the fifth election likely to result in his return as prime minister.  Second, the speaker believes the current division in Israel is necessary for reconciliation, which will lead to a unity government. This is a common occurrence in Israel's history, often during times of war. The speaker believes a major war is coming, possibly in 2020 or 2022, related to the Temple Mount and the Temple reconstruction. This will be a miraculous event, as Israel is currently secular. The speaker references Revelation 11, which speaks of a temple in Jerusalem and the two witnesses who will preach there for 1,260 days.  The speaker notes that the current political situation in Israel is complicated, with four major changes since the April election. The Arab public has increased its turnout and power, and the votes have shifted to minor parties. The speaker believes that God is forcing the Jews to work together to form a government, and this is a lesson for the church to work together as well.  The speaker encourages listeners to pray for the peace and prosperity of Jerusalem and to trust in God's deliverance. They believe that God is about to do an amazing thing and help Israel recapture and rebuild the third temple. The speaker thanks listeners for their support and invites them to join Discover Ministries and the Discover Online church.

summary:
Document 13
God is faithful and his plan to pour good things into our lives is through prayer.  We didn't make this up, it's in the Bible.  You can miss out on what God wants because you don't take the time to come before him like a good child would with their father.  The Bible encourages us to ask and we will receive, not scolding us but inviting us to come to him.  In times of trouble, we call on God and he answers.  He wants the best for us, not just a spiritual existence.  We see this in the Bible, from Moses to David, and even in the church's beginning in Acts chapter 2, which started with a prayer meeting.  Jesus is the same yesterday, today, and forever, and he loves to supply for his people.  He loves for us to look to him in faith, for without it, it's impossible to please God.  The church prayed for Peter and he was delivered from prison, and God's name was glorified.  Prayer mounts up before God and breaks through, sometimes taking time and perseverance.  When we pray, God sends something from heaven, like an angel or a deep sense of his presence.  He can wake people up, like my daughter who was far away from God, and give them a dream or a realization of their situation.  God can make chains come off, and he will give good things to those who ask him.  He's a loving father who wants to give good gifts to his children.  How much more shall your Father in heaven give good things unto them that ask him?  Hallelujah.

The speaker had a vivid rapture dream last night, where they heard the sound of a shofar, a trumpet-like instrument, and felt a strong sense of excitement and anticipation. In the dream, they were at a familiar gas station, where they met Christina, and they both felt a strong sense of joy and expectation as they waited to be lifted off the ground. The speaker described the sound of the shofar as mid-pitched and unique, and they were able to mimic it in their waking state. They felt a sense of confirmation and encouragement from God, and they believe that the rapture is near. The speaker has had similar rapture dreams before, where they felt their spirit and body being reunited, and they believe that this is a sign of the upcoming event. They encourage their viewers to stay hopeful and look forward to the redemption that is drawing near.

The speaker is discussing Sebastian Kurz, the former Chancellor of Austria, who won the elections on Rosh Hashanah and later visited Israel on the Feast of Trumpets. The speaker finds it interesting that Kurz is 33 years old, the same age Jesus was when he died on the cross, and is not married. They also mention that Kurz has a high IQ, is fluent in English, and has expressed support for a two-state solution in the Middle East and the protection of Israel. The speaker believes these similarities are suspicious and may be a sign of the Antichrist's return. They also mention that Kurz bears a resemblance to the actor who played the Antichrist in the movie Left Behind. The speaker is not claiming that Kurz is definitely the Antichrist but is warning viewers to keep an eye on him due to these unusual coincidences.

The speaker finds solace in their faith, knowing their Creator lives and is mighty. Despite facing trials, they're confident in their God's ability to overcome any challenge. They express a desire to share their experiences with others, proclaiming their God's strength and plans for prosperity. The speaker asks for the Holy Spirit to be poured out, believing it's only a matter of time before their God's power is revealed, leaving a profound impact on those who hear.

The speaker recently attended a wedding at the Cheesecake Factory and noticed various occult symbols throughout the restaurant. Upon entering, they saw a serpent wrapped around a red cup, symbolizing a blood offering, and a hexagram above the people eating. The hexagram is a symbol used in witchcraft and is associated with the demon star.   Next to the hexagram is the Islamic crescent moon and star, and the new age yin yang symbol. The speaker believes that these symbols are part of a larger effort to unite all religions under one umbrella. They also noticed an upside-down cross, which is a symbol of the Antichrist system, and a black serpent slithering down a tree.  The speaker points out that the pillars in each booth have a serpent eye, similar to the eye of Sauron from the Lord of the Rings. They also noticed a pine cone, which is a deep occult symbol, and a fiery serpent above the people. Saturn is also visible, which is an occult symbol.   The speaker believes that the occult is present in many places, including the Cheesecake Factory, and that it's up to believers to be aware of their surroundings and to walk in the Spirit. They encourage viewers to pray more and to fast more, and to be more aware of the occult in their daily lives.   The speaker also mentions that witchcraft is becoming the number one religion and that there are more people in the occult than people think. They invite viewers to join their ministry and to get involved in the fight against the occult.

Welcome to this special outreach update from Tel Aviv, Israel, with Messianic Rabbi Zef Porat.  Yeshua, Jesus, came to deliver us from sin, prison, and into eternal life.  In Isaiah 42:7, it's written to open the eyes of the blind, free captives from prison, and release those in darkness.  As believers in Yeshua, we understand being freed from prison means being freed from Satan's hands into eternal life through Yeshua HaMashiach.  In Luke 4:18, Yeshua stood in the synagogue, read from the scroll, and proclaimed himself to be deity, to be God.  He said, today this scripture has been fulfilled before your very eyes.  Yeshua's ministry started on the Day of Atonement, the year of the Jubilee, Shnat Yovel, according to the biblical calendar.  This is a prophetic picture of the eternal Jubilee with Yeshua HaMashiach, with Jesus forever and evermore.  We need to be on God's calendar to see the prophetic picture and prepare ourselves for his second coming as the bride of Yeshua, Jesus.  There are people in Israel and around the world serving time in prison, both spiritually and physically.  Our ministry launched several campaigns in Israel, blasting post boxes with Bible CDs and contact information revealing the Messianic prophecies.  An ex-convict named Haim contacted the ministry, sharing his story of being rejected by society after being released from jail.  We shared with Haim the love and forgiveness of God, and he was touched by the Bible CD he received.  We went through many Bible passages with Haim, and he finally asked, who is this Messiah that can set me free from prison forever?  Yeshua, Jesus, is the Messiah,

Hello everyone, I'm Messianic Rabbi Zef Porat, and welcome to Biblical Hebrew Foundation. Today, we're going to discuss the Feast of Trumpets, also known as Yom HaTorah. This feast is often misunderstood as the new year, but it's actually a significant event in the biblical calendar.  As believers in Yeshua, we need to focus on what the Word of God teaches, not what the rabbis or Pharisees teach. The feasts of the Lord are mentioned in Leviticus 23, and they're not just for the Jews, but for all those who are born again in Messiah Yeshua.  The word "feast" in Hebrew is "moed," which means a fixed appointed time. God wants us to proclaim and make recognizable these appointed times, to preach the gospel and share the truth with others. The Feast of Trumpets is a dress rehearsal, a time to prepare ourselves for the Second Coming of Jesus Yeshua.  There are three main points for the dress rehearsal: to prepare ourselves for His Second Coming, to proclaim and preach to our brothers and sisters, and to share the truth with the Jews in Israel and around the world.  The Feast of Trumpets speaks of repentance, and it's a day of memorial, a time to remember God. If we remember the Lord, He will remember us and write us in the book of remembrance. We can celebrate the Feast of Trumpets by remembering the Lord, singing, praising, and preparing ourselves for His second coming.  Let's celebrate the Feast of Trumpets together and wait for the final call. As we continue to stand together as the one new man, let's bring the gospel back to Jerusalem and go home. Until next time, I'm Messianic Rabbi Zef Porat sending you blessings from Jerusalem, Israel, in the mighty name of Ahariye

The speaker discusses three world-famous celebrities who were raised on the Bible: Katy Perry, Jennifer Lawrence, and Brad Pitt.   Katy Perry grew up in a Pentecostal home, handing out Christian pamphlets outside concerts, but her parents disagree with her music promoting homosexuality. Jennifer Lawrence was raised Christian, praying every night and attending church, but now doesn't believe in anything. Brad Pitt was raised in the Southern Baptist Church, but now sees a psychic and practices meditation and channeling.  The speaker asks viewers if they were raised on the Bible and have wandered from their faith, encouraging them to return to Jesus and share the good news with those who have strayed. The speaker emphasizes the importance of Jesus in giving eternal life and rescuing people from death.

I'm here at the Sea of Galilee, where Jesus walked on water, to get baptized again in full obedience to his command. I fell away from God in my late teens and early twenties, becoming an atheist and engaging in sinful behaviors. However, Jesus rescued me from addiction and spiritual darkness. Today, I'm declaring publicly that my faith is in Jesus Christ, and I'm renouncing my past. Through baptism, I'm symbolically showing my death to this world and my rebirth in Christ. I hope this witness will inspire others to take the step of obedience to Jesus and publicly declare their faith through baptism.   As we're here, I'm reminded of Jesus' power and glory. He's our great high priest who understands our weaknesses and sympathizes with us. Let's come boldly to the throne of grace and obtain mercy in times of need. I'm now baptizing you in the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit, as a symbol of your confession of faith to Jesus Christ.   Just like Peter walked on water when he kept his eyes fixed on Jesus, we need to keep our eyes fixed on Him during the storms of life. We need to pray for every brother and sister around the world to stay focused on Jesus and not sink. The Lord truly loves us, and He's not someone we can't trust. He offers us His peace and rest, which we can find in Jesus Christ. If you haven't been baptized, I encourage you to do so, and let's praise God for His love and victory through Jesus' death and resurrection.

The speaker is visiting the Shrine of Our Lady of Akita in Japan, a site of a controversial apparition in the early 1970s. The apparition, witnessed by Sister Agnes Sasagawa, involved a weeping statue that was witnessed by a priest and a diocesan priest. The tears from the statue were analyzed and found to be of human origin. The speaker is skeptical about the apparition, but notes that the lack of enthusiasm and information about the site is unusual. The shrine is quiet, with no welcoming committee or nuns to greet visitors. The speaker compares it to other famous apparition sites, such as Lourdes and Fatima, where visitors are greeted with enthusiasm and information about the site's history and significance. The speaker notes that the message of Akita is anti-Vatican and anti-humanism, and that it is very similar to the message of Fatima. The speaker is surprised by the lack of information about the apparition and the site's significance, and notes that even Buddhist visitors were unaware of the site's purpose. The speaker concludes that the experience is "eerie" and that it may be a last-ditch effort from heaven to prevent the crisis in the church.

We're in a war between the flesh and the Spirit, and the devil comes to inflame our flesh.  The Holy Spirit has been sent to wage war against every lust and enticement of our flesh.  This battle is ongoing as long as we live, and we can't win it alone.  We need faith and confidence in the word of God, and the Holy Spirit is our prayer warrior, strength, and might.  He's the living power of Almighty God, and we must acknowledge and receive His power.  The devil wants to isolate us and make us feel like we're the only ones struggling with sin.  But the Bible says these temptations are common to all flesh, and we're not alone.  We must trust the blood of Jesus Christ and His cleansing power in our lives and not listen to the devil's lies.  God is faithful and will not allow us to be tempted above what we can bear.  He'll make a way of escape that we may be able to endure it.  The Holy Spirit is the only power that can bring change in this world.  We need to acknowledge and receive His power, and it comes through the prayer room and the intercessor. In this last day, the church of Jesus Christ is going to be the same fire that fell on the day of Pentecost. Good morning everyone. Today's Course in Miracles lesson is number 37: "My holiness blesses the world." This idea signifies the end of sacrifice and offers everyone their full due as a son of God. It's about seeing the world through your own holiness, blessing everyone and everything, and restoring wholeness to those who see themselves as whole.   To practice this idea, repeat it for three to five minutes, then apply it to whatever you see, using names and saying "my holiness blesses you." You can alternate between applying the idea to your surroundings and to those in your thoughts. It's essential to use this idea, especially when interacting with others who may cause an adverse reaction.   Jesus shares that his holiness blessed the world during his last incarnation, and it was not an individuated energy but a frequency emanating from his unobstructed consciousness. This frequency is powerful in its creative abilities and can cause spontaneous miracles to happen. The clarification of the mind is crucial when understanding that whatever comes through you is magnified by what's in you.

summary:
Document 25
The speaker emphasizes the importance of following Jesus, which involves denying oneself, taking up one's cross, and following him. This process is called sanctification, where one becomes more like Christ through an ongoing repentant heart and a relationship with him. The speaker explains that salvation has three elements: justification, sanctification, and glorification. Justification is being saved from the penalty of sin through faith in Christ's gift of grace. Sanctification is a lifelong process of growing in a Christ-like character through the indwelling Holy Spirit. Glorification is receiving a new, sinless body after death and being like Christ.  The speaker warns against mixing up justification and sanctification, which can lead to legalism and a misunderstanding of the sufficiency of Christ. They emphasize that salvation is not maintained by human effort, but rather, the Holy Spirit works in believers to help them overcome sin. The speaker encourages believers to come boldly to the throne of grace, knowing that Jesus, their great high priest, sympathizes with their weaknesses and has overcome sin.
Document 26
The speaker emphasizes the importance of finding peace and fulfillment in life through Jesus Christ. They argue that people often try to find happiness through material possessions, substances, and other temporary means, but ultimately come up empty. In contrast, Jesus Christ offers a path to true peace, redemption, and salvation.  The speaker explains that Jesus' lordship is based on his ownership and authority over all things, including the earth and its inhabitants. They cite various biblical passages to support this claim, including Jesus' statement that all power has been given to him in heaven and on earth.  The speaker also highlights Jesus' power and authority, noting that he was able to perform miracles, heal the sick, and conquer death itself. They argue that Jesus' power is not limited by human means, and that he cannot be defeated or destroyed.  The speaker concludes by emphasizing the importance of acknowledging Jesus as Lord and Savior, and of seeking him while he may be found. They quote various biblical passages, including Psalm 23, to emphasize the benefits of following Jesus and dwelling in his presence.  Ultimately, the speaker's message is one of hope and redemption, emphasizing that Jesus Christ is the only source of true peace, fulfillment, and salvation. They encourage listeners to seek Jesus and to dwell in his presence, where they will find rest, refreshment, forgiveness, guidance, companionship, comfort, and joy.

Many of you are going through a time of great stress and pressure, feeling overwhelmed by your situation.  You've tried everything, prayed, and fasted, but nothing seems to be working.  The Bible tells the story of a woman with an issue of blood who was stuck between a rock and a hard place, but she had faith in Jesus.  She believed that if she could touch the hem of his garment, she would be healed.  Despite the crowd and her own suffering, she fought her way through to Jesus and was healed.  The difference between her and others was her faith.  Jesus said, "Your faith has healed you."  Faith is the answer to your situation.  It's the power that can turn your life around.  You don't need great faith, just the faith of a mustard seed.  Believe in a God who never fails, who is faithful and will not leave you.  You may be facing fear, doubt, and past failures, but you need to fight through them.  You need to have a bulldog tenacity and say, "Nothing will stop me from believing in God."  Mistakes, unbelief, the past, pain, failure, doubt, fear, and uncertainty will not stop you.  You will live by faith and not by sight.  God regards faith highly and it's impossible to please him without it.  So, have faith in God.  Believe in him and his power to change your life.  Your faith can see the unseeable, transcend time, and look into the future.  It's complete and utter confidence, choosing to believe and not to doubt.  It takes only one idea to change your current circumstances, one encounter with Jesus to change a lifelong problem.  Believe in God and you will be healed, you will be free, and you will be whole.

They studied Ecclesiastics 12:14, which says God will bring every deed into judgment, including every hidden thing. Shimon was shocked to learn that Rabbi Yitzhak Kaduri, a respected rabbi, had left a secret revelation revealing the name of the Messiah as Yeshua or Yehoshua, Jesus.  This revelation was hidden by the rabbis, but Shimon was hungry for the truth and wanted to learn more. They studied Isaiah 7:14, which says a virgin will conceive and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel, meaning God is with us. Shimon was amazed by the supernatural sign and realized that the rabbis had hidden the Messiah from them.  Rabbi Porat and Shimon continued to study the Bible, and Shimon eventually accepted the truth that Yeshua, Jesus, is the Messiah. Hello everyone, I'm Spencer, and today I want to discuss the topic of wealthy preachers. A recent list from CheatSheet.com revealed the top 10 richest preachers in North America, with Kenneth Copeland having an estimated net worth of $300 million. Many people criticize these individuals, claiming that their wealth is a sign of being charlatans and not right with God.  However, I believe that having wealth is not inherently wrong. In the Bible, Abraham had wealth, and Zacchaeus, a rich man, came to the Lord and repented. The issue is not having wealth, but rather being covetous and letting wealth control us.  The Bible warns in 1 Timothy 6:10 that the love of money is the root of all evil, not the having of money itself. Matthew 6:33 says to seek the kingdom of God first, and all things will be added unto you. It's not about having wealth, but about wealth having us.  In a capitalistic society, people can earn wealth through legitimate means, such as book deals, DVDs, and conferences. The issue is not the money, but the doctrine that these individuals teach and preach. Many of these preachers, such as Joel Osteen and Kenneth Copeland, teach false doctrine and exploit people theologically, which leads to them exploiting people monetarily.  The Bible warns in 2 Peter 2 about false prophets and teachers who make merchandise of God's people through covetousness and feigned words. The issue is not the money, but the false doctrine and the exploitation of people.  I'm not mad that these individuals have wealth, but I am mad that they preach and teach false doctrine, which leads to people being exploited theologically and monetarily. The issue is the doctrine, not the money. Let's focus on dealing with the root of the problem, which is the false doctrine

Today's lesson, lesson 43 of A Course in Miracles, is "God is my source. I cannot see apart from him." This idea emphasizes that perception is not an attribute of God, but rather the Holy Spirit serves as a mediator between perception and knowledge. The Holy Spirit's purpose is to transform perception into knowledge, leading to forgiveness and healing.   To apply this idea, three five-minute practice periods are recommended, with the first phase involving looking around and applying the idea to specific subjects, and the second phase involving closing eyes and letting relevant thoughts add to the idea. The idea should also be applied throughout the day to various situations and events, particularly those that seem distressing.  Jesus reminds us that we are blessed beings, created by God with a unique place in the mind of God. He encourages us to remember our sanctity and the qualities we have been given, which will become more evident as we remove untrue ideas and confusions from our mind. By clarifying our minds and walking closer to love, we can overcome suffering and achieve a life of fulfillment.

You are the object of God's affection, but the devil is out to get you. He may pretend to help, but his goal is to destroy you and frustrate God's plan in your life. The devil knows he can't win against God, so he targets you to take you down.   You are in a war for your life, family, and soul. The enemy will use every strategy to enter your life, weaken you, and tempt you. But you have the power to resist him. The word of God is your sword, and you need to know what is written and speak it out loud.   When the enemy comes, stand your ground and tell him you have the authority to tread on snakes and scorpions and over all the power of the enemy. Use scriptures like Philippians 4:13, "I am able to do all things through Christ who strengthens me," and Isaiah 54:17, "No weapon formed against me shall prosper."   Recognize that you're in a fight and learn to fight. Don't give up, even when it seems impossible. God is faithful, and you will come out victorious in the end. The enemy is a defeated foe, and Jesus has triumphed. You have the right to demand your rights and privileges in Christ Jesus and to walk in full victory.

The speaker discusses Bill Gaither, a prominent figure in Christian music, and his alleged shift towards Roman Catholicism. However, the speaker also criticizes Gaither for his involvement in the ecumenical movement and his recent song "Jesus is Everywhere," which they claim promotes Roman Catholicism.  The speaker argues that Gaither's song contains lyrics that are reminiscent of the Roman Catholic practice of transubstantiation, which they believe is an occult ritual. They also reference Revelation 17, which describes the "great whore of Babylon" as a false church that persecutes the true church. The speaker believes that the Roman Catholic Church fits this description and has a history of killing non-Catholics.  The speaker warns against the dangers of theological compromise and the road to Rome, which they believe is the ultimate destination of those who seek to hold hands with liberals and conservatives. They urge listeners to be discerning and to know their Bible, church history, and the truth in order to avoid being swept away by bad doctrine.  The speaker concludes by warning against the pitfalls of compromise and the importance of being separate from error and apostasy. They express concern for Bill Gaither's alleged shift towards Roman Catholicism and encourage listeners to be cautious and to seek truth.

This title can be used to witness to Jews who refuse to believe in the New Testament.  Jesus is described as wearing a garment down to his feet, with a golden girdle around his waist. The passage also describes Jesus' voice as sounding like many waters, and his right hand holding seven stars. The speaker compares Revelation 1:13-16 to the book of Malachi 4, which describes God coming down to judge his enemies and establish holiness. The speaker discusses the relationship between Christianity and gun ownership, citing biblical passages to support their argument. They claim that Jesus' teachings in the kingdom of heaven were temporary and not meant for the current era. In Luke 22:36-38, Jesus tells his disciples to sell their cloaks and buy swords, indicating that self-defense is acceptable.  The speaker argues that governments are appointed by God to maintain order and control evil, citing Romans 13:1-7. They claim that a community without government descends into chaos and violence, and that the use of violent force is necessary to maintain control.  The speaker shares a story about an Amish community in Belize that was attacked by Guatemalans, who took their valuables and held their men hostage. The Amish community's pacifist stance allowed the Guatemalans to continue their attacks, including raping the Amish women.  The speaker concludes that Christians should not be pacifists and that gun ownership is a necessary aspect of self-defense. They claim that God gave humans the ability to defend themselves and that Christians who do not use this ability are foolish and cowardly.  The speaker emphasizes that they are not a pacifist and that their community believes in America, God, the Bible, and guns. They warn that anyone who claims to be a Christian but is a pacifist should not be around them.

Dr. Frank Stranges claims to have met Valiant Thor, an alien from Venus, in the 1950s. Thor allegedly met with President Eisenhower and the Joint Chiefs of Staff, offering advanced technology and a plan for world peace. However, the US government rejected his proposals, citing concerns about the impact on the economy and industry.  Thor was reportedly given VIP status and spent time at the Pentagon, where he met with Dr. Stranges. He had no fingerprints, a navel, or fingerprints, leading Dr. Stranges to believe he was a created being, like an angelic being.  Thor's mission was to bring peace and advanced technology to Earth, but he was met with resistance from the US government and other world leaders. He met with many world leaders in 1958, including those from Russia, England, and Japan, and proposed a plan for world unity and disarmament.  Admiral Richard E. Bird, a US Air Force employee, also claims to have knowledge about Thor's arrival and meeting with the US government. He believes that Thor's presence was shrouded in secrecy and that the government was aware of his arrival before it happened.  Valiant Thor is said to be living on a spacecraft near Lake Mead, Nevada, with his complement. His legacy remains a topic of debate, with some believing that his proposals could have changed the course of human history.

Some of you are going through the greatest trial of your life, whether physical, financial, or emotional.  This one verse, Nahum 1.7, is a beaming light of hope: "The Lord is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble.  He cares for those who trust in him."  Regardless of your situation, the Lord is good and is a stronghold in the day of trouble.  He can remove barriers, heal broken marriages, and bring answers to your problems.  God loves and cares for you individually, and he didn't wait until you got your life together to be good to you.  He loved you before the foundations of the earth, and he will never change.  His goodness is a part of his very essence, and everything he does is for our good.  We must give thanks for his love and salvation.  Remember that God loves you, and he will never fail.  Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and he'll take care of you, direct your path, and provide for your needs.  May the Lord be with you, reveal his love and closeness to you, and encourage and strengthen you as you keep your eyes upon him.

Michael Pearl, a 73-year-old, answers question 37 about cremation in the Bible. He notes that cremation is mentioned only once in the Bible, in 1 Samuel 31:12-13, where Saul and his sons are cremated. However, this does not imply that cremation is the preferred method of burial.   The reason people are concerned about cremation is that they worry about how their bodies will be resurrected if they are cremated. Michael Pearl argues that God is capable of reconstituting the body from its ashes, citing Ezekiel's valley of dry bones and Jesus' statement in Mark 13:27, where he says that God will gather his elect from the four winds.  Michael Pearl also notes that the method of burial in the Bible was determined by practicality, with burial being the easier option in many cases. He quotes Jesus' statement in Luke 9:59-60, where he tells a man to let the dead bury their dead and go preach the kingdom of God, indicating that the form of burial is not as important as the person's faith.  Ultimately, Michael Pearl concludes that God is capable of reconstituting the body from its ashes, and that people should not worry about the method of burial.

The speaker points out various occult symbols and imagery on the boulevard, including the Anunnaki, pentagram stars, and obelisks, which they believe are evidence of the industry's connection to Satanism.  The speaker draws a parallel between the biblical story of Satan's fall from heaven and the way celebrities are "initiated" into the industry, often through dark rituals and sacrifices. They claim that the stars on the boulevard are a representation of the fallen angels and that the industry is governed by the principalities and powers of darkness.  The speaker calls on celebrities to repent and turn to Jesus Christ, and warns Christian producers and media people to stop bowing to the dragon and using Christ as a cloak. They also pray for the salvation of celebrities and the exposure of pedophiles in the industry.  The speaker emphasizes the importance of spiritual discernment and warns against the occult and witchcraft that is prevalent in Hollywood. They call on Christians to stand firm and refuse to compromise with the industry, and to reach out to lost souls with the power and authority of God.

A Jehovah's Witness and a Baptist preacher had a conversation about their beliefs. The Jehovah's Witness explained that Jesus Christ is not God in the flesh, but rather a created being, citing scriptures such as John 1:1 and Colossians 1:15. The Baptist preacher disagreed, stating that Jesus is God incarnate and the Savior of man, citing scriptures such as John 1:14 and Colossians 1:16.  The Jehovah's Witness mentioned that the name "Jehovah" is not found in the original Greek manuscripts, but rather in the King James Bible, which was translated from the original Hebrew and Greek texts. The Baptist preacher countered that the name "Jehovah" is found in some older King James Bibles, and that the Watchtower Bible and Tract Society is not a reliable source for biblical truth.  The conversation turned to the topic of Bible reading and the importance of studying scripture for oneself. The Jehovah's Witness offered to give the Baptist preacher a piece of literature, but the Baptist preacher declined, stating that Jehovah's Witnesses do not take literature from others.  The Baptist preacher shared a personal story about starting a church in Nairobi and converting almost 90% of the local Jehovah's Witnesses. He stated that he believes Jehovah's Witnesses are teaching a false gospel and that Jesus Christ is God in the flesh.  The conversation ended with the Baptist preacher stating that he believes the Jehovah's Witness is a false teacher and that he is troubled by their beliefs. The Jehovah's Witness offered to take back the literature, but the Baptist preacher declined, stating that he would keep it as a reminder of their conversation.

They suggest that when these different lines meet, it will be clear that the enemy's plan is unfolding.  The speaker emphasizes that it's not about being afraid or scared, but rather about being aware and informed. They encourage listeners to pray about these issues and to be mindful of the subtle ways in which the enemy is working to deceive and control people. Michael Pearl is answering a question about blasphemy against the Holy Spirit. He reads the relevant Bible passage from Matthew 12:22-32, which states that all manner of sin and blasphemy can be forgiven, but blasphemy against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven. He explains that the word "blaspheme" means to speak derogatorily of something sacred.  The context of the passage is Jesus healing a man possessed by a demon, and the Pharisees accusing him of casting out demons by Beelzebub, the prince of demons. Jesus responds by saying that if Satan casts out Satan, his kingdom is divided against itself and cannot stand. He also says that if he casts out demons by the Spirit of God, the kingdom of God has come.  Michael Pearl explains that blasphemy against the Holy Spirit is not just saying something bad about Jesus or God, but rather attributing the work of the Holy Spirit to the devil. He gives an example of a person who says that the Holy Spirit is not working through Christians, but rather through an evil spirit.  He also discusses the idea that people may inadvertently or casually commit this sin, but notes that Jesus says that by every idle word that we speak, we will be justified or condemned. He believes that those who speak against the Holy Spirit have a heart that is already estranged from God and distant from Him.  Michael Pearl shares a personal anecdote about a person who said he couldn't trust Jesus because he had blasphemed against the Holy Spirit. He explains that no one can know for sure if they have committed this sin, but if they live their life against the work of the Holy Spirit, they will eventually know. He emphasizes that it's up to each individual to decide when it's too late to be saved.

The speaker references the parable of the fig tree, where a tree that doesn't produce good fruit is cursed and cast into the fire. They see this as a warning to those who reject Jesus Christ, who will be cast into hell and suffer eternity. The number 144 holds significance for the speaker, but they don't elaborate on its meaning. They believe this event is a sign of the last days and a warning to those who don't follow God's word.

Take a look back at your life, all the struggles, heartbreak, and challenges you've faced.  God was with you through it all.  He has plans to prosper you, not to harm you.  This is not the end, and joy will come in the morning.  Weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.  Life is a fight, and every single one of you is in the middle of a battle.  Fighting to get bills paid, finish school, keep your marriage together, and more.  Life doesn't fight fair, and when you're in the middle of a fight, another challenge arises.  At this point, David encouraged himself in the Lord.  He reminded himself that he was a child of God and that he would get through this.  You will have to encourage yourself at some point in your life.  Your family, friends, and pastor may not be able to do it, but you must stand as an individual and talk to yourself.  You are a child of God, and you will get through this.  Greater is He that is in you than he that is in the world.  The problem in our lives is that we don't know scripture enough.  We need to memorize Bible verses to help us through difficult situations.  Speak the word of God into your life, and encourage yourself with scripture.  If you wake up knowing it's going to be a tough day, remind yourself that God's strength is made perfect in weakness.  Stop relying on other people to pick you up, as most people don't care about your situation.  Help is not on the way in terms of human help.  People will turn away from you during tough times, but you have a God who wants you to encourage yourself.  Be strong in the Lord, not in yourself.  You are not alone; someone else lives

Former Israeli Prime Minister Ariel Sharon has passed away at the age of 8. A Rabbi Kadouri disciple shares his reaction, calling it a great blessing and a fast process. He references the Bible, stating that the name of the Lord is great and will influence people worldwide.
Document 84
On April 9th, 2019, Steve Fletcher discussed the Donald Trump peace plan, also known as the "Deal of the Century," set to be presented on May 15th. He linked this event to a biblical warning, specifically the seven-day warning given to Noah before the great flood. The peace plan aims to bring peace to the Arab nations and the Middle East by dividing Jerusalem, with Israel making concessions.   The plan reportedly includes establishing a Palestinian state in 90% of Judea and Samaria, with part of eastern Jerusalem as its capital. This would involve evacuating isolated settlements and outposts considered illegal by Israeli law. The Temple Mount, Western Wall, and Mount of Olives would remain under Israeli sovereignty but with administrative partnership with the Palestinians.  Biblical confirmations of this event can be found in Zechariah 12, which talks about the division of Jerusalem and the consequences of nations coming against it. The chapter also mentions the lead-up to the Battle of Armageddon, a major event during the Great Tribulation. In 1 Thessalonians 5:3-4, it is written that when people say "peace and safety," sudden destruction will come upon them. This could be related to the peace plan's promise of peace and safety, but ultimately leading to destruction.
Document 85
God answers prayers in various ways, including through angelic vehicles. The Bible describes angels as ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation. In Daniel 10:12, an angel was sent to respond to Daniel's prayers, but was delayed by the prince of the Persian kingdom and Michael, one of the chief princes. This demonstrates that praying to God can cause angels to be sent to help us in times of need.  The Bible tells us to pray in times of trouble, as seen in James 5:13, which says "Is any among you in trouble? Let them pray." God is waiting for us to call upon him, and he has the resources of heaven and earth at his fingertips. However, the enemy can hinder our prayer life through distractions, condemnation, and making us feel unworthy.  As children of God, we need to be assured of God's love and not let the enemy dishearten us from praying. The Bible says that nothing can separate us from God's love, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord. Our relationship with God is not dependent on our performance, but on what Jesus did on the cross.  The love of God is not a free pass to live a life of sin, but it should encourage us to live a life that glorifies God. We should strive to be more like Jesus Christ, who often went to pray and seek his heavenly Father. The objective of Christianity is to be more like Jesus, and prayer is a key part of that.  Prayer is not a last resort, but a vital part of our relationship with God. It is our communication with the Lord, our hope when all is lost, and a cry of the heart. Prayer is the bridge between us and God, and it can bring joy and strength to our lives. We should pray our way out of trouble, and not be lackadaisical about our approach to prayer
Document 86
Today's Daily Course in Miracles lesson is lesson number 44, "God is the light in which I see." To see, we must recognize that light is within us, not outside. We cannot make light, but we can make darkness and think we see in it. Light reflects life and is an aspect of creation. To reach the light, we must let go of our ego's interference and intrusions.   The exercise for today involves repeating the idea with eyes open and closed, then trying to sink into our minds, letting go of all interference. We should observe our passing thoughts without involvement and try to think of light as formless and without limit. If resistance rises, pause to repeat the idea. Throughout the day, repeat the idea often with eyes open or closed.  Jesus encourages us to go beneath our thoughts to a deep awareness that is always present within us. This awareness is a quiet and profoundly stable space that is not associated with the physical body. It is consciousness, pure and untrammeled by the ego mind. Be kind to yourself today and try to connect with that stillness within. As you master these abilities, you will begin to have experiences of expansion and connection to something other than the world.

The speaker describes a personal struggle with feelings of isolation and despair, comparing themselves to a "baby cup crying for a father" to help. They express a sense of being lost in darkness, denied help, and trapped in a "living hell" of depression. However, they recall a turning point where they felt Jesus intervene, breaking their emotional chains and bringing them hope. The speaker reflects on how far they've come and expresses gratitude for Jesus' presence, acknowledging that they will never forget the distance they've traveled from their darkest moments to their current state of hope and redemption.

I sold my soul to the devil, and I'm still out here, holding up my hand. I made a bargain with destiny a long time ago. The greatest trick the devil ever pulled was convincing the world he didn't exist. He didn't promote himself as the truth; instead, he created a system of people who would sell their souls for a piece of his kingdom.  Satan deceived the world by putting people in positions of influence and conditioning them to deceive others. These people are experts, authorities, and celebrities who have sold their souls. They lie to the world, and we believe them because we trust authority. We're deceived because we don't question the truth, and we're convinced not to question experts, professionals, and educated people.  Satan knew exactly who to pick to deceive us. He chose people who would believe them if the formula was laid out correctly. We vote for politicians knowing they lie, and we believe in our politicians despite knowing they're liars. We're greatly deceived, and we listen to nothing but deceivers. We have never known the truth in this life.  Satan deceived this world by using people we trust, putting name tags on them as experts, professionals, and authorities. We took the bait, especially Christians who claim to understand scripture but still live in the world. We're afraid to let go of this world for fear of losing our identity. Our identity is now in Christ, not this world, which is an absolute 100% deception.  Finally, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might. Put on the whole armor of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil. We wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.
Document 89
The speaker is about to reveal a hidden message from God that was discovered by their father in 2005. This message is hidden in the Bible's genealogy in the book of Luke and was revealed when their father studied the original Greek manuscripts without bias. By looking up the original meanings of each name in the genealogy, their father was able to piece together a message from God that was previously unknown. The message is a beautiful and emotional revelation of God's plan for humanity and His love for us. It reads: "I, God, made man. Appointing mortal man to own, to speak well of me, to rule over, to be diligent. Man threw away my power and rest. Named the deliverer. My own grew up, passing through to divide. My son, the branch, that thirsted for and awaited his exalted father's laughter. He superseded through speaking well, reaching the walls of discipleship." This message is a powerful reminder of God's love and plan for humanity, and it's a revelation that will open the eyes of those seeking truth.
Document 90
The speaker shares a word from the Lord about how God can use anyone, regardless of their background or intentions, to plant seeds of faith and bring people to Him. They reference various Bible verses, including 1 Corinthians 1:27 and John 3:16, to emphasize God's ability to use the foolish and weak things of the world to confound the wise. The speaker notes that God used people like Joseph, Daniel, and the Babylonians to accomplish His will, even if they were not saved.  The speaker then applies this concept to Kanye West and Kim Kardashian, suggesting that God can use them to plant seeds of faith in people's lives, even if they are not saved themselves. They reference Kanye's Sunday Service, a musical ministry that has evolved into a Christian church service, and how it has been used to bring people to Christ.  The speaker warns against killing the seed of faith by being too quick to judge or criticize those who are planting it, and instead encourages people to water the seed and allow God to bring the increase. They emphasize the importance of being open-minded and not judging others based on their background or intentions, but rather on their willingness to serve God.  The speaker concludes by saying that their ministry is to challenge people's perspectives and to help them see the world from a different point of view. They encourage people to be transformed by the renewal of their minds and to seek knowledge and understanding, rather than relying on self-righteousness and ignorance.
Document 91
The speaker is discussing the book of Revelation and the doctrine of the imminent return of Jesus Christ. They believe that Jesus Christ's return can happen at any moment, which is why they are pre-tribulationists. They argue that the Bible supports this doctrine, citing Revelation 1:1 and 22:20, where Jesus says "I come quickly." The speaker also addresses the criticism that if Jesus is coming soon, it has been 2,000 years, and responds by saying that to God, 2,000 years is like a blink of an eye.  The speaker emphasizes the importance of getting revelation from the right source, citing the process of God giving revelation to his servant John through his angel. They stress the need to find the right God, Jesus, angel, preacher, and servant in order to receive accurate revelation. They also discuss the importance of bearing record of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ, and how this relates to the right preacher and the church.  The speaker also explains that the book of Revelation is a book for the tribulation timeline, not the church age, and that it is a prophecy of the future. They emphasize the importance of taking the book of Revelation literally and not spiritualizing or chopping off verses, as this can rob people of a blessing. They conclude by saying that premillennialism is the correct approach to understanding the book of Revelation.
Document 92
The speaker believes that the false prophet of Revelation and the Antichrist have been hiding in plain sight for years. They claim that Pope Francis is the false prophet, citing a prophecy by Saint Francis of Assisi that matches Pope Francis's actions. The prophecy states that a man not canonically elected will be raised to the pontificate and will lead many into error. The speaker also mentions a report that dozens of rogue cardinals forced Pope Benedict to retire and led others into deals to elect Pope Francis.  The speaker believes that Pope Francis has been lying and blaspheming from the start, and that the Catholic Church is a church of blasphemy and heresy. They claim that Pope Francis will lead up to a one-world religion, where the Antichrist will be worshipped. The speaker also mentions that Barack Hussein Obama is the Antichrist, and that they are convinced of both of these things.  The speaker warns viewers to wake up and understand what's going on, and to pray for salvation if they haven't already. They encourage viewers to share the video and help spread the word about the Great Commission. The speaker also mentions that they pray for viewers every day and invites them to contact them for prayer.

Breaking news from the Middle East, four ships have been damaged off the UAE coast, with fingers pointing towards Iran. Tensions are high, and the world is on the brink of World War III. As a prophecy teacher, the speaker emphasizes that Christians are not looking for war but for Jesus Christ's return to end all wars. The speaker believes that God loves all nations, but people are choosing to fight each other rather than giving their hearts to Jesus.  The speaker provides a timeline of events, including Washington's withdrawal from the 2015 peace pact between Iran and global powers, and the subsequent ratcheting up of sanctions on Tehran. The US has sent an aircraft carrier and B-52 bombers to the Gulf in a show of force, and Iran has called the US military presence a target rather than a threat.  The speaker references Revelation 6, which describes the seven seals of Revelation, and notes that the third seal mentions not harming the oil and wine. The speaker believes that this could be a reference to the current situation, where oil prices are rising due to the tensions in the Middle East.  The speaker also mentions the conflict between the Sunnis and Shias, which has been brewing for centuries. The speaker believes that this conflict will eventually lead to a major war in the Middle East, possibly in 2020.  The speaker references various biblical prophecies, including 1 Samuel 14, which describes the Philistines fighting each other, and 2 Chronicles 20, which describes the children of Ammon and Moab fighting each other. The speaker believes that these prophecies are being fulfilled in the current situation.  The speaker also mentions the fall of Babylon the Great, which is described in Revelation 18. The speaker believes that Saudi Arabia is a possible candidate for Babylon, and notes that the country is facing problems with its shipping, including the recent sabotage of two of its oil tankers

It's extremely hot outside, with temperatures reaching 102 degrees. The speaker shares an amazing dream they received from the Lord, which is their fourth dream in their lifetime. In the dream, they and their husband hear an explosion outside, and when they go outside, they see beams of light coming from the sky, resembling sun rays and thousands of stars. The Lord gives them an understanding that these are angels, and they realize that what's happening is the rapture. The speaker feels their soul being raptured up, similar to their previous dream. They believe the explosion was the graves being busted open, as described in the Bible.  The speaker emphasizes that they know their dreams are from the Lord and wants to encourage others who are watching and waiting. They believe we are in the season of Jesus' return, as described in the Bible. The speaker mentions various natural disasters, such as tornadoes and earthquakes, and encourages people to watch and be prepared for Jesus' return. They stress that Jesus wants a relationship with everyone and that accepting him into their heart is all that's required.  The speaker shares their personal experience as a sinner who wants to please God and not sin. They encourage others to accept Jesus and not make it harder than it is. They suggest asking for a prophetic dream to seek Jesus out and understand the coming events. The speaker believes Jesus is coming soon and wants to wake people up to the reality of their situation. They conclude by encouraging everyone to be awake and not asleep when Jesus returns.

The speaker had a vivid dream that they believe was from God. In the dream, they were in a large city with skyscrapers, surrounded by a white chemtrail-like substance and the aftermath of missiles being fired. They saw angels popping out and blowing trumpets, which sounded terrifying. The speaker then saw Jesus or God coming on the clouds, dressed in red, with two other people on white horses beside him. They felt a tsunami-like wave engulfing the city, and they woke up in shock.  The speaker believes that the dream was a vision of the second coming and the tribulation. They are convinced that the rapture of the church will happen before the tribulation and that they will be raptured up out of the world at any second. They want to reassure their viewers that God will save them from his wrath and that they should not be afraid.  The speaker is overwhelmed by the experience and feels privileged to have seen it. They are concerned for those who will have to go through the tribulation and the terrifying trumpet sounds. They urge their viewers to be ready for the rapture and to meet Jesus in the clouds. The speaker will return to talk more about the dream and its meaning at lunchtime.

The speaker discusses the Seventh-day Adventist church and its teachings, expressing concerns about its potential cult-like behavior. He notes that the church requires members to accept the teachings of Ellen White, a woman who claimed to have received visions from God, as inspired commentary on the Bible. The speaker argues that Ellen White's writings are not infallible and that she made several false prophecies, including predicting that Jerusalem would never be rebuilt and that England would attack the United States during the Civil War.  The speaker also criticizes the church's teachings on the investigative judgment, which he believes is a false doctrine. He notes that the church teaches that Satan, not Jesus Christ, bore the sins of humanity, and that the mark of the beast is keeping worship on Sunday, rather than Saturday.  The speaker concludes by urging listeners to leave the Seventh-day Adventist church, which he believes is a corrupted institution. He emphasizes that worshiping on Saturday is not a requirement for being a Christian and that individuals should be free to choose their own day of worship.

They argue that the video was "whack" and that the message was not truth. The speaker claims that Christians are being unfairly targeted and that the real issue is not about hate, but about the push to impose certain values and lifestyles on others. The passage in John 6:44 and 65 is often misinterpreted by Calvinists to mean that no man can come to God unless God chooses them. However, this is not the correct interpretation. The context of the passage is about Jesus offering everyone to come to him and believe in him. Jesus says, "This is the work of God, that you believe in him whom he has sent." He's offering everyone the opportunity to believe in him.  The passage also mentions that the Father draws people to Jesus, but it's not a one-way street. Jesus says, "All that the Father gives me will come to me, and whoever comes to me I will never drive away." This means that the Father is actively drawing people to Jesus, but it's not a predetermined choice. People have the freedom to choose to believe in Jesus.  The Bible teaches that God desires for all people to come to repentance, and that he is actively drawing people to himself. Jesus says, "I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life." This means that God is shining his light on everyone, but not everyone chooses to follow him.  The correct interpretation of the passage is that the Father draws people to Jesus, but it's not a predetermined choice. People have the freedom to choose to believe in Jesus, and the Father gives them to Jesus when they do. Jesus says, "I will raise him up at the last day," meaning that he will give eternal life to those who believe in him.

Messianic Rabbi Zef Porat shares a special outreach update from Jerusalem, Israel. He believes we're living in prophetic times, with the second coming of Jesus Yeshua near. The Bible says the scepter will not depart from Judah, referring to Jesus Yeshua, who will take back what the enemy has stolen.   During a recent outreach, Rabbi Porat shared the line of the tribe of Judah with people in the Holy Land. Many were excited to hear the truth, and several Jews got saved. He met an orthodox man named David, who was studying to be a rabbi, and shared the Bible with him. David was fascinated by Rabbi Porat's answer when he said he only studies the written word of God.  As they read the Bible together, David asked who the scepter of Judah was speaking about. Rabbi Porat explained that it was Jesus Yeshua, the one from the line of King David, the Eternal One, and the Messiah. David was getting nervous, but Rabbi Porat shared the full gospel with him, explaining that Jesus Yeshua has already come and will return again.  A man named Yossi joined the conversation and asked about the Messiah. Rabbi Porat explained that Jesus Yeshua came, died on the cross, rose on the third day, and will return to rule and reign. Yossi was speechless, and Rabbi Porat quoted Psalms 27, saying "The Lord is my light and my Yeshua." Something supernatural happened, and Yossi left the conversation. Rabbi Porat prays for Yossi's salvation, and he encourages David to seek the word of God and be set free.

The speaker expresses skepticism towards Christian celebrities, particularly those who attend Hillsong and Bethel churches. They argue that these individuals often have to compromise their values to succeed in the entertainment industry, which is inherently wicked. The speaker cites examples of celebrities like Chris Pratt and Carrie Underwood who have been involved in immoral projects, suggesting that they are contractually obligated to do so.  The speaker also questions the nature of spirituality, suggesting that true Christians should be set apart from the world. They argue that it's impossible to love Jesus and the world at the same time, citing 1 John 2:15. The speaker believes that many churches are preaching a watered-down version of Christianity that is acceptable to the world.  The third reason the speaker doesn't trust Christian celebrities is that they often lead double lives. They argue that it's impossible to serve God and the world simultaneously, citing Joshua 24:15 and 1 Kings 18:21. The speaker believes that these individuals will eventually have to choose between their faith and their careers.  The speaker concludes by urging the church to stop looking to the world for heroes and instead look to their local church members. They suggest that the church should celebrate the unsung heroes in their midst, such as Sunday school teachers and pastors, rather than famous celebrities. The speaker believes that the judgment seat of Christ will be a surprise to many people, as God will reveal that the people the world thought were heroes were not as important as they seemed.

Document 104
The speaker shares a powerful message about the presence of angels in our lives. According to the Bible, every person has an angel assigned to them from birth, tasked with ministering and protecting them. The angel's role is to watch over us, keep us safe, and guide us in times of crisis. The speaker shares a personal story of a young woman named Danielle, who was protected by her angel when she was attacked in an alleyway. The angel's presence was revealed when the attacker confessed that he had seen two tall men walking with Danielle, which was actually her angel.  The speaker emphasizes that our angel is constantly watching over us, even when we're unaware of their presence. They are fighting battles on our behalf, both seen and unseen, and are busy warring for our victory. The speaker reminds us that we are valuable to God, not because of anything we've done or will do, but simply because He loves us. God's love for us is demonstrated by the fact that He sent His only begotten son to die for our sins.  The speaker shares a story of a man who was healed by God after Brother Barnes prayed for him, but what's remarkable is that the man believed Brother Barnes had stayed with him in the hospital room, even though it was actually his angel who was present. This illustrates the idea that our angel is always with us, even in our mistakes and bad decisions.  The speaker concludes by reminding us that we are loved, protected, and divinely guided. We may not be able to see our angel, but we can trust that they are always with us, watching over us and keeping us safe. The speaker's message is one of hope, comfort, and reassurance, reminding us that we are precious to God and that He loves us more than we can ever understand.

Hello everyone, I'm feeling a bit scatterbrained today, but I wanted to take a break and talk to you about something important. I want to ask you, do you truly know how much Jesus loves you? We often hear that Jesus loves us, but do we really understand the depth of his love? If we could fathom it, I think we'd feel more worthy, stand taller, and keep our heads higher.  Jesus wants a relationship with you, not just a religion. He wants you to accept him into your heart, seek him, and you'll find him. He'll reveal himself to you and deliver you from evil. He loved you so much that he created a way out for you, dying on the cross for your sins. He wants to take away your burdens, including sin, depression, anxiety, and fear.  If you're struggling, cry out to him with a genuine heart and say, "Take it off of me, Lord." He might not deliver you immediately, but he will. I know this from personal experience. He'll change your life, heart, and desires. If you don't know what to believe, cry out to him and say, "Lord, I'm a sinner in need of a savior." He'll show up.  We're not guaranteed our next breath, and we don't know when Jesus will return. If you were to die tomorrow, cry out to him because he's offering you a free gift – everlasting life. He died for you, and that's a love like no other. Talk to him when you're alone, and he'll reveal himself to you. I love you guys, and I'll talk to you later.

I knew in my heart that this was a sign from God that it's almost time to go home.  As I grew older, I realized that God had a big plan for my life, and this YouTube ministry is a part of it. I truly believe that we are the generation that will see His return. The Lord has given me multiple dreams, including one where I was raptured out of my bed with my husband. This dream gave me confirmation that He is coming soon.  I want to encourage you to start planning how you will spread the gospel this week. Time is short, and we need to make the most of it. Don't listen to mockers and scoffers; instead, keep doing what you're doing and giving people what you receive from the Lord. We have an important job to do, and I'm excited to see what God has in store for us. Let's keep spreading the gospel and getting ready for His return.

Rabbi Porat gave them a CD with contact information and prayed that they would come to know Yeshua as their Messiah.
